thread.title: Dalston Kingsland train evacuated due to 'smoking drill'
thread.title_full: Dalston Kingsland train evacuated due to 'smoking drill'

title: Dalston Kingsland train evacuated due to 'smoking drill'
text:
Dalston Kingsland train evacuated due to 'smoking drill' 8 February 2017 Close share panel Image copyright PA Image caption Passengers were evacuated from the commuter train in Dalston after a workman's drill began 'smoking' A London commuter train has been evacuated after the battery pack on a workman's drill overheated and began smoking on one of the carriages. 
London Fire Brigade confirmed it was called at 07:11 GMT but said the incident was dealt with by 07:24 GMT. 
Images from the scene at Dalston Kingsland, east London, showed people standing alongside the tracks and along the platform at the London Overground station. 
The station was temporarily evacuated. 
A man in a high-visibility jacket was reported to have told commuters there was a "small fire" on the train. 
In a statement the London Fire Brigade said: "Firefighters have dealt with a small incident on a train at Dalston Kingsland station this morning. Image copyright PA Image caption Passengers were treated for minor injuries by the ambulance service 
"A workman's drill had overheated and started smoking. Firefighters extinguished the battery and placed it in a bucket of sand." 
London Ambulance Service said it treated a small number of people at the scene for minor injuries.
